Posts.Content: Nov 21, 2008 12:57PM clmarr wrote: The biggest reason to have a DIEP or SIEPÂ (not reccomending TRAM due to more side effects) as opposed to implants, is that implants after mastectomy, because there is no tissue, have a 47% rate of failure (requiring surgical intervention) within the first 5 years. I am an RN and did LOTS of research, and decided that this was best for me. I had a bilateral mastectomy 11 months ago, and am very pleased with the results. It was longer recovery than implants, but it is permanent. Again though, it is a personal choice, and a tough one at that. Good Luck!
Posts.Title: anyone who's had a tram flap s3434 clmarr
